subject: Re: [junit] Multiple expected exceptions
msgSnippet: Yang, I would probably write these as separate methods.  Would that work for you? David Saff
messageBody:
Yang,

I would probably write these as separate methods. Would that work for you?

David Saff

On Wed, Jun 3, 2009 at 12:41 PM, Yang Zhang <yanghatespam@...> wrote:
> Hi, I currently write tests involving multiple expected exceptions as:
>
>   try { ...; fail("expected exception"); }
>   catch (ExpectedExcepton ex) {}
>
>   try { ...; fail("expected exception"); }
>   catch (ExpectedExcepton ex) {}
>
> Is there a better way?  I know that you can use Test(expected=...)
> annotations for single expected exceptions.  Thanks in advance.
> --
> Yang Zhang
> http://www.mit.edu/~y_z/
>
>
